hackathon-description-text: Connected Lab, the global leader in connected software experiences, is hosting the Amazon Alexa and Echo Hackathon from Friday, March 11, 2016 to Sunday, March 13, 2016 at Connected Lab’s Headquarters in Toronto, Ontario. The Amazon Alexa and Echo Hackathon will explore voice-based user interfaces for Alexa, the software that supports Amazon’s Echo hardware.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each team member will receive an Amazon Echo (USD $179.99, not available for sale in Canada yet).
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Echo (for each winning member of team)
Interview for paid internship or full-time opportunity with Connected Lab

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=370 King St W #300, Toronto, ON M5V 1J9, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: “What can voice interfaces do better than apps?”
Voice interface, grading of voice experience, UI/UX if it involves apps
Non-obviousness (novelty)?, is it in a new unexpected way? Use case and desirability.

hackathon-location-address: 370 King St W #300, Toronto, ON M5V 1J9, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Finding opportunities where a voice interface is better than a graphic interface. Basically bringing the movie, "Her," to life.
